primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) must maintain its identity and fulfill its mission of self-giving love (Object) to conquer the totalizing power of the Empire (Opponent) under the mandate of God (Sender).

tekstueel_bewijs: folks alongside Jesus are different folk who belong to a different family
we have another life to live in the world
They [the ones born of God] are not preoccupied with their own status... but get their minds off themselves

object.identificatie: A radically different life of self-giving love and systemic justice.
tekstueel_bewijs: giving one’s self away in deep engagement with others
sustained, systemic efforts of program and policy that have restorative impact
this heavenly father... has clear expectations
This God of the gospel is always recruiting folk
loving the neighbor whom we can see
the neighborhood is transformed and enhanced
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must perform the task.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, Son of God, as a brother, a partner, a companion
This is the victory that conquers the world, our faith
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender/Recruiter; Jesus is the Helper/Model.

tekstueel_bewijs: the totalizing power of the empire
conventional consumerism (with its strong military component)
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a socio-political system rather than an ontological or spiritual power (Sin/Death) that requires divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (Subject) births/baptizes the believer (Object) into a new family.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: While the sermon starts with 'Born of God' (Soteriology), it quickly pivots to this identity being a 'pedigree' that enables the human Subject to perform the 'demanding summons' (Ethics).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Church → Conquering the World through Love

voorbeelden_god_subject: God of the gospel is always recruiting folk
God has birthed to new life
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have another life to live
we love God... by loving the neighbor
anyone who seriously invests in neighborliness... will find joy

voorbeelden: not preoccupied with their own status
remind and affirm to the church its special identity
this congregation has always known better
transformative intention of God entrusted into our hands

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir) and motivation (Vouloir). It assumes the hearer has the power (Pouvoir) if they simply remember their identity (Savoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Jeopardy (~S2) to Identity (S1) through the performance of the Summons.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human 'resolve' and 'imitation' of Jesus.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High in a political sense, low in a spiritual/soteriological sense.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite using 'born of God,' the engine of the sermon is Exemplarism. Jesus is a 'companion' and 'teacher' to be imitated. The 'victory' is something 'entrusted into our hands.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God... is always recruiting folk to an alternative purpose.
We love God... by loving the neighbor.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Everyone who believes... has been born of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the 'Friday guy' whose actions we must replicate to achieve the same result.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The 'young man' (as negative example of empire)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ has conquered the world; therefore, we are already safe, regardless of our success in 'transformative energy'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'systemic efforts' to prove identity.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically inverted; the 'Amazing Promise' is contingent on the 'Demanding Summons'.
spanning_punten: The 'victory' is called an 'amazing promise' but is described as our 'faith' and 'resolve'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Imitate me... be present in the world differently.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned as the source of Pouvoir-faire.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'the empire' and 'self-preoccupation' rather than a condition requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for social activism. God is the Recruiter, Jesus is the Coach, and the Church is the Hero.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The Church is the subject of 'conquering'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject of the victory over the Empire.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We conquer the world,' use 'Christ has disarmed the powers, setting us free to love without fear.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize being 'born of God' as a gift rather than a pedigree for work.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit enables love that is otherwise impossible.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the 'Empire' within the human heart (Sin).
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is only a social system, we don't need a Savior, only a better policy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The promise is the 'end' of the sermon rather than the 'ground'.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Victory of Christ) → Identity (Born of God) → Ethics (Neighbor love).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong social conscience, but it risks exhausting the hearer by making 'Love Wins' a human task rather than a divine finished work.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is inspiring; actantially, it is a heavy burden of Devoir-faire.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: The exegesis correctly identifies the 'Empire' context but misses the passive nature of 'born of God' in Johannine theology.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Jesus' is merely a 'Helper' actant here, not the 'Subject' of the salvation narrative.

volledige_subject_lijst: Those born of God (conquer the world)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the phrase 'Love Wins' but structurally implies 'Our Love Wins'.
